predicate.note: Frames file for 'extend' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison to 'give'.

roleset.name: make longer

role.descr: agent, entity making something be longer
EXT or TMP, by how much or until when

example.name: TMP as 'until'
example.text: Dow Jones & Co. said it extended its $18-a-share offer for Telerate Inc. common stock until 5 p.m. EST Nov. 9.
example.arg: its $ 18-a-share offer for Telerate Inc. common stock

example.name: TMP as 'to'
example.text: Institut Merieux S.A., which offered 942 million Canadian dollars (US$ 801.2 million), or C$37 a share for Connaught, said it would extend its bid, due to expire last Thursday, to Nov. 6.
example.arg: its bid, due to expire last Thursday,

example.name: with start and end points
example.text: Alpine Group Inc. revised its exchange offer for $43.7 million face amount of 13.5% senior subordinated debt due 1996 and extended the offer to Oct. 27 from Oct. 12.

example.name: temporal EXT
example.text: After the opening was delayed 30 minutes because of the crush of sell orders, Frankfurt's normal two-hour trading session was extended *trace* 75 minutes to handle the heavy volume.
example.arg: After the opening was delayed 30 minutes because of the crush of sell orders

example.name: temporal adjunct
example.text: Two rival bidders for Connaught BioSciences extended their offers *trace* to acquire the Toronto-based vaccine manufacturer Friday.
example.arg: Two rival bidders for Connaught BioSciences
their offers to acquire the Toronto-based vaccine manufacturer

roleset.note: The different kinds of Arg2s and TMPs can be confusing. Use this rule of thumb: * If it can be paraphrased as an "until", use Arg2-TMP. * If it can be paraphrased as a "by", use Arg2-EXT. * If it can be paraphrased as an "on", use ArgM-TMP.

example.name: Arg2 as PP
example.text: ``This is the first time, if we decide to do so, for Japan to extend aid of this kind to Eastern European countries,'' the spokesman said.

example.name: ditransitive
example.text: In recent months a group of lenders, led by Bank of America, has extended Control Data up to $90 million in revolving loans through January, as well as $115 million in standby letters of credit.
